pwm module¶

class simdna.pwm.Mutation(index, previous, new, deltaScore, parentLength=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

class to represent a single bp mutation in a motif sequence

applyMutation(stringArr)[source]¶

set the base at the position of the mutation to the mutated value. Modifies stringArr which is an array of characters.

checks that stringArr is consistent with parentLength if defined

revert(stringArr)[source]¶

set the base at the position of the mutation to the unmutated value Modifies stringArr which is an array of characters.

class simdna.pwm.PWM(name, letterToIndex={'A': 0, 'C': 1, 'T': 3, 'G': 2}, background=OrderedDict([('A', 0.27), ('C', 0.23), ('G', 0.23), ('T', 0.27)]))[source]¶

Bases: object

addRow(weights)[source]¶
computeBestHitGivenMatrix(matrix)[source]¶
computeSingleBpMutationEffects(bestHitMode)[source]¶
computeSingleBpMutationEffectsGivenMatrix(matrix)[source]¶

matrix is some matrix where the rows are positions and the columns represent a value for some base at that position, where higher values are more favourable. It first finds the best match according to that matrix, and then ranks possible deviations from that best match.

finalise(pseudocountProb=0.001)[source]¶

getLogOddsRows()[source]¶

sampleFromPwm()[source]¶
scoreSeq(seq, scoreSeqOptions)[source]¶
scoreSeqAtPos(seq, startIdx, reverseComplement=False)[source]¶

This method will score the seq at startIdx:startIdx+len(seq). if startIdx is < 0 or startIdx is too close to the end of the string, returns 0. This behaviour is useful when you want to generate scores at a fixed number of positions for a set of PWMs, some of which are longer than others. So at each position, for startSeq you supply pos-len(pwm)/2, and if it does not fit the score will automatically be 0.
